links.title:
Solving the Expression Problem
      
        ‚Äì journal.stuffwithstuff.com
links.description:
I started working on Magpie out of frustration with a lot of the languages I
used. One of the key itches I wanted to scratch is something called the
expression problem. The original formulation of it isn‚Äôt very helpful to
someone not writing a compiler, so I‚Äôll recast it to something that‚Äôs a little
more tangible and relevant to the kind of code you find yourself writing.

Because Unicode contains such a large number of characters and

links.title: Equilibrium in Cryptoeconomic Networks
links.description:
A cryptoeconomic network is a network where


  nodes perform tasks that are useful to the network,
  incur costs while doing so,
  and get compensated through fees paid by the network users, or rewards
generated by the network‚Äôs protocol (usually in the form of a currency native
to the network).


Reward generation causes the supply of network currency to increase,
resulting in inflation. Potential nodes are incentivized to join the network
beca...
